info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 8:20PM CDT until May 25 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Little River near Tecumseh affecting Pottawatomie and Seminole Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Near bankfull flows occur along the river and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 8.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then rise to 9.3 feet tomorrow morning. It will fall to 7.5 feet tomorrow evening. It will then rise to 8.0 feet early Monday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING
